content.description: Start from the deep huecos a few feet up and climb to the good, golf-ball sized hueco about half way up. Then climb up and left, using the crater/bullseye and a crimp or two. Top out directly above the crater (a few feet right of A New Slope) on non-existent holds that faintly resemble slopers. Don’t get bucked off!
content.location: Stand start from the deep huecos under the golf-ball sized hueco.

content.description: Sit start (or “Sith Start”) under the left side of the scoop and climb into the scoop.  Then mantel straight over the middle of the scoop to top out.  (No cheating by exiting on the slabby right side.)
content.location: Start on a few good jugs under the left side of the scoop.

content.description: Start from the deep huecos a few feet up.  Climb to a good, golf-ball-sized hueco about half way up, then up and slightly right on gradually worsening holds.  The top out is not trivial.
content.location: Stand start from the deep huecos under the golf-ball-sized hueco.

content.description: Start on the far left side of the boulder, with hands on a good ledge about five feet left of the big scoop.  Traverse right, eventually getting yourself into the scoop (probably the crux).  Traverse right through the scoop, then down and along the entire south side of the boulder, ending with hands matched on a high and small hueco on the southeast side.
content.location: When facing the south side of the boulder, the start is on the left side, about five feet left of the big scoop.

content.description: Start from a 45-degree foothold and a juggy sidepull/undercling to the right of the scoop.  Climb straight up, eventually topping out on delicate slopers.
content.location: Start at the good, 45-degree angle ledge for a foot, which is a few feet right of the scoop.
